chargeHist.descr: Hit and Run-Involve Great Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant Abel Olalde-Gonzalez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run-Involve Great Bodily Harm, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: -The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges including the DNA and victim and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections and as a condition of probation/ extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
-AODA and other counseling needs to be determined; random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: With HUBER for work. REPORT BY 3/31/2022 by 12:00pm

charges.descr: Hit and Run-Involve Great Bodily Harm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Abel Olalde-Gonzalez

records.addlTxt: Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, for review. cmc

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1: 

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of  60 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 0 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 30 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 30 MONTHS.  

The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  

The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of  3 YEARS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction with HUBER for work.  REPORT BY 3/31/2022 by 12:00pm
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges including the DNA and victim and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections and as a condition of probation/ extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
- The Court Order the defendant's driver license REVOKED for 24 MONTHS
-AODA and other counseling needs to be determined; random urine screens.
-Seek and maintain full-time employment.
-Perform 60 hours of community service at a non-profit charitable organization.


The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
The defendant is advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.

FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Abel Olalde-Gonzalez in court with Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea and sentencing hearing.    The plea and sentencing hearing was held in person.   Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Sworn as interpreter: Patrick Ryan
 

Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
 
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire and jury instruction received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint/Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record. 
 
-The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    
-Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   


FILED: Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights; Addendum to plea questionnaire and waiver of rights; Jury Instructions/Elements of the Offense; Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Abel Olalde-Gonzalez in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Abel Olalde-Gonzalez in court with Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening. Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Reme Bashi. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/ed5b9ae0-0153-fff4-9924-88d8db5a37c1  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 15, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Entry of January 19, 2022 made by DCC Ashley Zoril for DCC Holly Jones, due to computer issues.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kirsten J.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Abel Olalde-Gonzalez in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Defendant Abel Olalde-Gonzalez in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
